content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a solution using the Markdown parsing capabilities of the Documenter package in Julia:

```julia
using Documenter: parse_blocks, Code, FieldItem, Documents
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = parse_blocks(md)
    code_blocks = filter(x -> x.args[1] isa Code, blocks)
    code_strings = map(x -> String(x.args[2]), code_blocks) # assuming that the code block content is a Symbol 

    return join(code_strings, "\n")
end
```
Please note, it's assumed that markdown code blocks are represented as ```julia ... end ``` and all spaces/indentations inside them are stripped. If you have different representation of your code blocks, this function would need to be adjusted accordingly. 

Also keep in mind, Documenter package is not included by default with Julia. To add it to your project, run `Pkg.add("Documenter")` command in the Julia REPL.
